page.title: 09 THE MOTTRAM ARTIST
page.content: Overlooking Hattersley is the imposing Mottram Church which nods to its tiny village and watches carefully over Hattersley. The most famous occupant of Mottram is L.S.Lowry, the artist who painted local industrial scenes and matchstick men. The house he lived in is being sold but the memory of the old artist lingers. The local people in the entire area are very proud of him. Before he died a local doctor and his wife visited him at his house. During the conversation he said "Do you think I'll be remembered in 50 years' time?" "Of course you will," they said. "I doubt it," said Mr Lowry. His paintings are being sold for large amounts of money and we feel Mr Lowry was wrong-he will be remembered.
